intro: Veronica langei var. nevadensis, commonly known as the Sierra veronica, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Plantaginaceae family and is characterized by its slender, upright growth habit. The plant produces clusters of small, blue to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It typically thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in rocky or gravelly habitats. Its delicate appearance and specific ecological requirements make it a notable species in alpine and subalpine regions.
